title: Trillions of Plastic Bits, Swept Up by Current, Are Littering Arctic ...
body: Plastic debris in the ocean was thought to accumulate in big patches, mostly in subtropical gyres — big currents that converge in the middle of the ocean — but scientists estimate that only about...
readable_content: - The article talks about a study published in Science Advances that reveals how a major ocean current is carrying plastic debris from the North Atlantic to the Greenland and Barents seas, thereby polluting the Arctic waters. The researchers believe that as climate change continues to shrink the Arctic sea ice cover, more human activity in the area will cause plastic pollution to spread further. This study draws attention to the growing issue of plastic pollution in the world's oceans and its potential impact on the Arctic region (The New York Times, 2017-04-19).
summary: The article highlights the concerning discovery that a major ocean current is carrying plastic debris to the Arctic, emphasizing the growing issue of plastic pollution and its potential impact on the region. This emphasizes the urgent need to address plastic pollution in the world's oceans. Sentiment: 0.8
